DOC.brief_summary: This study prospective , double-blind , randomized comparison study different anesthesia method rhytidoplasty surgery . The study design determine whether post-operative side-effect profile patient undergo elective cosmetic facelift surgery decrease use propofol/ketamine anesthesia bispectral monitoring ( PKA-BIS ) rather general anesthesia , without increase intra-operative time , side-effect profile , patient recall . Approximately 30 subject undergoing facelift surgery perform principal investigator participate .
DOC.detailed_description: PKA-BIS arm receives follow medication : clonidine 0.1-0.2mg glycopyrrolate 0.2mg propofol infusion titrate BIS 60-75 ketamine 50mg + additional ketamine exceed 200mg aggregate dosage throughout case local anesthetic ( lidocaine/marcaine mix ) General Anesthesia arm receive follow medication : Pre-operatively : Pepcid 20mg Scopolamine 1.5mg transdermal patch Versed 2mg Zofran 8mg Reglan 10mg Glycopyrrolate - dose determined anesthesiologist During case , medication choice dose dependent anesthesiologist - general anesthesia case receive inhalational anesthetic ( type anesthetic also vary base anesthesiologist 's choice )
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : Female 18 year age old Undergoing elective rhytidoplasty Exclusion criterion : Male Under 18 year old Pregnant breastfeeding Medically unfit undergo surgery Undergoing browlift conjunction rhytidoplasty ( due inability properly secure BIS monitor would lie within surgical field )
